<denchmark-h:h2>Support Vector Machines Reference</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>The reference states that the method CvSVM::get_support_vector_count() return the number of support vector used to train a SVM Model and the method CvSVM::get_support_vector(int i) retrieves the i-th support vector coordinates. Actually the first return always 1 for linear SVM and the latter return the decision function (hyperplane) coefficients. Even if it is more useful this way, the functions names are confusing and the reference inaccurate. Also the example at http://docs.opencv.org/doc/tutorials/ml/introduction_to_svm/introduction_to_svm.html shows a different result than the one reported on the page (the real support vectors are not highlighted while it is computed the normal vector to the separation hyperplane and it is drawn a point representing it but it is out of the window) </denchmark-code>
